Title: Phenol hemihydrate: Redetermination of the crystal structure by neutron powder diffraction, Hirshfeld surface analysis and characterization of the thermal expansion
Source: Acta Crystallographica Section E: Crystallographic Communications
Abstract: © 2020.Phenol hemihydrate, C5H5OH·0.5H2O, crystallizes in the space group Pbcn, Z = 8. The previously published crystal structure [CSD refcode PHOLHH; Meuthen & von Stackelberg (1960). Z. Elektrochem. 64, 387-390] is shown to be incorrect. Pairs of phenol molecules, related by an inversion centre, are bridged by one water molecule via O - H?O hydrogen bonds; an extended R 4 4(8) hydrogen-bonded motif links these inversion dimers into chains parallel to the c axis. Packing of the chains is achieved by weaker T-shaped C - H?p interactions between nearest neighbour phenol molecules in the bc plane. Analysis of the thermal expansion and parameterization with a Debye model in terms of the linear elastic moduli shows that the c axis is ~3 times stiffer than the two orthogonal directions.
